Hello Deepa, 

I ran a test crawl with your NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule and got the expected results. 

You might want to try adding this line to logging.properties:

org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideRuleSequence.level = FINEST

It will tell you the result of each decide rule and the final decision for each url. 

(Unfortunately it wasn't logging the url in question, but I've added that and I think the latest build at http://builds.archive.org:8080 should have it.)

One thing to keep in mind is that very few urls will be discovered if you restrict crawling exclusively to css. Since html won't be crawled, css referred to in the uncrawled html will not be discovered.

Noah


DEEPA R wrote:
> Hi, 
> 
> I am trying to narrow my crawl by allowing only css types of files to be accepted. For this I am using the "NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule" with the properties like :
> 
>   <bean class="org.archive.modules.deciderules.NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule">
>       <property name="decision" value="REJECT" />
>       <property name="regex" value=".*(/|\.css)$" /> 
>  </bean>
> 
> with the other rules in this order , as on the manual :
> 
>    1. RejectDecideRule
>    2. SurtPrefixedDecideRule
>    3. TooManyHopsDecideRule
>    4. PathologicalPathDecideRule
>    5. TooManyPathSegmentsDecideRule
>    6. NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule
>    7. PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule
> 
> But I am getting all types of files like pdf , images and not getting the css files . I am not able to figure out where am I going wrong. Any help is greatly appreciated.
> 
> Thanks.
>
